column4: Is there any way to install ubuntu without burning the image ISO?
There are a number of ways. Using a USB stick works.
What OS do you have on your machine now.
You can do it a few different ways.
So, you don't want any of the data on the drive now?
You can use unetbootin, or boot from the iso using grub2 as two options.
You're going to need one of two things. A USB key with >=700Mb, or you can try booting the ISO from grub2 and then reinstalling Ubuntu from that.
Those are the easiest ways I know of to reinstall Ubuntu without a cd and without using other computers in the process.
I have a USB and I already told you the partitions in this USB Drive
I'm just saying you have some choices. :)
You can boot into windows and use wubi if you wanted.
You have those options. Take them or leave them, it's all I can give you.
Probably reformats it in the process.
It's possible, that if you just ran unetbootin, you just reformatted your usb drive. If you didn't run it, then you didn't lose your data.
you are the guys more consufin in the worls
